title: Import OO CA certificate into the suite
content:
After completing the OO installation, you must import the OO CA certificate into the suite before you can deploy the OO capability in Suite Administration.

Refer to the section applicable to your deployment.

Classic deployment

To import the OO CA certificate into the suite on a classic deployment, follow these steps:

  1. Get the OO CA certificate by following the document Get OO CA certificate.

  2. Rename the .CER file to .crt file using the command line.

  3. Change the ownership of the file OO certificate by using the command chown <SYSTEM_USER_ID>:<SYSTEM_GROUP_ID> <path-to-global-volume>/certificate/source/.  

    For <system_user_id> and <system_group_id>: specify an operating system user ID and group ID respectively that are used to run the process in the container. Both values must be 1999 or a number between 100000 and 2000000000 (for example, UID=100001 and GID=100002).

  4. Copy the saved .crt file into <path-to-global-volume>/certificate/source/. Example of <path-to-global-volume>: /var/vols/itom/global-volume

  5. Restart the platform pods by running the following commands: 
    kubectl rollout restart deployment -n <ITSMA_NAMESPACE> itom-xruntime-platform
kubectl rollout restart deployment -n <ITSMA_NAMESPACE> itom-xruntime-platform-offline

Helm deployment

  1. To import the OO CA certificate into the suite on a helm deployment, refer to the steps in Import CA certificate into the Suite.
  2. Restart the platform pods by running the following commands: 
    kubectl rollout restart deployment -n <ESM_NAMESPACE> itom-xruntime-platform
kubectl rollout restart deployment -n <ESM_NAMESPACE> itom-xruntime-platform-offline

    Where:

    • <ESM_NAMESPACE> is the unique namespace of the suite deployment.
